dcterms:creator: János Komlós
Endre Szemerédi
dcterms:description: Erdős-Rényi random graphs are used to evaluate the Hamiltonian cycle problem, particularly in the critical regime where the edge probability is adjusted based on graph size to control the existence of Hamiltonian cycles.
dcterms:title: Erdős-Rényi random graphs

dcterms:creator: Michael Haythorpe
dcterms:description: The Fhcp challenge set consists of structurally difficult instances of the Hamiltonian cycle problem, providing a benchmark for evaluating algorithms.
dcterms:title: Fhcp challenge set

dcterms:creator: G Reinhelt
dcterms:description: TSPLIB is a library of sample instances for the traveling salesman problem (TSP) and related problems, providing a variety of datasets for testing algorithms.
dcterms:title: TSPLIB

dcterms:creator: Mikhail Kolmogorov
Derek M. Bickhart

dcterms:description: Metaflye is a scalable long-read metagenome assembly tool that utilizes repeat graphs, providing a dataset for evaluating genome assembly algorithms.
dcterms:title: Metaflye
